intro: Churumaya, commonly known as the "crown of the Andes," is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its striking violet or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and can reach heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are woody and often branched. Churumaya is valued not only for its ornamental beauty but also for its medicinal properties in traditional Andean medicine.
